title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 373-2.5 - Continued coverage of recipients who receive increased earnings from employment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 373-2.5 - Continued coverage of recipients who receive increased earnings from employment

State Regulations
(a) If a refugee, an asylee or a

Cuban/Haitian entrant who is receiving RMA receives earnings from employment, the earnings shall not affect his or her continued RMA eligibility. (b) If a refugee, an asylee or a

Cuban/Haitian entrant who is receiving Family Assistance or Medicaid has been
residing in the United States for less than the time-eligibility period for
RMA, and becomes ineligible for either program because of earnings from
employment, the individual must be transferred to RMA without a RMA eligibility
re-determination. (c) The
provisions of subdivisions (a) and (b) of this section apply to a recipient of
RMA until the recipient reaches the end of his or her time eligibility period
for RMA as described in section
373-2.3
(c) of
this Subpart. (d) In cases where a
refugee, an asylee or a Cuban/Haitian entrant is covered by employer-provided
health insurance, any payment of RMA for that individual must be reduced by the
amount of the third party payment. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§§
373-2.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
